events.originalText: Pope Francis became the first pope to celebrate a papal Mass in the Arabian Peninsula.
events.subtitle: Pope Francis
events.headline: Pope Francis Celebrates First Papal Mass in Arabian Peninsula

events.originalText: The United States Navy guided missile cruiser  Port Royal ran aground (pictured) on a coral reef off the island of Oahu.
events.subtitle: United States Navy
events.headline: U.S. Navy Cruiser Port Royal Runs Aground on Coral Reef

events.originalText: Eighty-seven tornadoes occurred over the course of the Super Tuesday tornado outbreak across multiple U.S. states, causing 56 deaths and over $1 billion in damage.
events.subtitle: Tornado
events.headline: Super Tuesday Tornado Outbreak: 87 Tornadoes, 56 Deaths, $1 Billion in Damage

events.originalText: The National Revolutionary Front for the Liberation of Haiti captured the city of Gonaïves, starting a coup d'état against President Jean-Bertrand Aristide's government.
events.subtitle: National Revolutionary Front for the Liberation and Reconstruction of Haiti
events.headline: National Revolutionary Front Captures Gonaïves, Initiates Coup in Haiti

events.originalText: At least 21 cockle-gatherers were drowned by an incoming tide in Morecambe Bay, England, prompting the establishment of the British government's Gangmasters Licensing Authority.
events.subtitle: Common cockle
events.headline: Tragic Incident in Morecambe Bay: 21 Cockle-Gatherers Drowned

events.originalText: Second Chechen War: As the Battle of Grozny came to a close, Russian forces summarily executed at least 60 civilians in Grozny's Novye Aldi suburb.
events.subtitle: Second Chechen War
events.headline: Russian Forces Execute Civilians in Grozny Suburb

events.originalText: The mayors of Carthage and Rome signed a symbolic peace treaty to officially end the Third Punic War, 2,134 years after it began.
events.subtitle: Carthage (municipality)
events.headline: Carthage and Rome Sign Peace Treaty to End Third Punic War

events.originalText: After a mid-air collision with a fighter plane during a practice exercise off Tybee Island, Georgia, a U.S. Air Force bomber jettisoned a Mark 15 nuclear bomb, which was presumed lost.
events.subtitle: 1958 Tybee Island mid-air collision
events.headline: U.S. Air Force Bomber Jettisons Nuclear Bomb After Mid-Air Collision

events.originalText: Australian cricketer Bill Ponsford made 429 runs to break the world record for the highest first-class score.
events.subtitle: Cricket
events.headline: Australian Cricketer Bill Ponsford Breaks World Record with 429 Runs

events.originalText: The U.S. Congress overrode President Woodrow Wilson's veto to pass the Immigration Act of 1917, establishing new restrictions on immigrants, including the wholesale ban of people from much of Asia.
events.subtitle: United States Congress
events.headline: U.S. Congress Overrides President Wilson's Veto on Immigration Act of 1917

events.originalText: Claudio Monteverdi's last opera, L'incoronazione di Poppea, was performed theatrically for the first time in more than 250 years.
events.subtitle: Claudio Monteverdi
events.headline: Claudio Monteverdi's L'incoronazione di Poppea Performed Theatrically After 250 Years

events.originalText: Belgian chemist Leo Baekeland announced his invention of Bakelite (production device pictured), the world's first synthetic plastic.
events.subtitle: Leo Baekeland
events.headline: Chemist Leo Baekeland Invents Bakelite, First Synthetic Plastic

events.originalText: Prospectors in Moliagul, Australia, discovered the largest alluvial gold nugget ever found, known as the Welcome Stranger.
events.subtitle: Moliagul
events.headline: Welcome Stranger: Largest Alluvial Gold Nugget Found in Moliagul, Australia

events.originalText: In a speech before the U.S. Congress, Representative John Edward Bouligny refused to join his fellow Louisiana congressmen in heeding the state's secession convention and resigning.
events.subtitle: United States Congress
events.headline: Representative Bouligny Refuses to Resign Amid Louisiana Secession Convention

events.originalText: Charles XIV John (pictured) succeeded to the thrones of Sweden and Norway as the first monarch of the House of Bernadotte.
events.subtitle: Charles XIV John
events.headline: Charles XIV John Becomes First Monarch of House of Bernadotte in Sweden and Norway

events.originalText: The first of five strong earthquakes hit the region of Calabria on the Italian Peninsula, killing more than 32,000 people over a period of nearly two months.
events.subtitle: 1783 Calabrian earthquakes
events.headline: Calabria Region Hit by Series of Earthquakes, Over 32,000 Dead

events.originalText: Pompeii was severely damaged by a strong earthquake, which may have been a precursor to the eruption of Mount Vesuvius that destroyed the town 17 years later.
events.subtitle: AD 62
events.headline: Pompeii Damaged by Earthquake, Possible Precursor to Vesuvius Eruption
